intro: Sesamum senecioides subsp. transvaalense, commonly known as the Transvaal sesame, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its seeds in some regions.
